Node On Linux

Apr 28, 2015

Node.js

Node.js is a JavaScript-based framework/platform used to develop I/O intensive web applications. Being open source, completely free, anyone can contribute and be a part of it.

NPM

NVM acts as a packet manager for node. It provides online repositories for node.js projects, facilitates command line interface for the installation of Node.js packages, version management and dependency management.
Installation can be done using following commands:

  • For installing packages
    npm install async

  • For installing dependencies
    npm install

  • For installing modules
    npm install

NVM

NVM supports version management of node.js versions. It is a simple bash script that provides the functionality of quickly switching to other versions of node.js.
NVM can be installed using following steps:

  1. Updating the packages already present
    sudo apt-get update

  2. Installing the build essential packages
    sudo apt-get install build-essential libssl-dev

  3. Installing NVM
    curl https://raw.githubusercontent.com/creationix/nvm/v0.25.0/install.sh | bash

  4. Once this is done, close and restart the terminal and add the following command
    source ~/.profile

Node version

  • To check the node versions present on your machine
    nvm ls

  • To switch to a particular version
    nvm use <-version->
